description:
Count Erich von Hartenburg was the deputy commissioner of the Imperial Police during the late Goldenbaum Dynasty, and was considered to be the most likely candidate to be the next commissioner. It was also rumoured that he would eventually become the minister of internal affairs.
However, he ended up being murdered by his sister, Elisabeth von LÃ¼neburg, on 1 December 794 UC, as she found out that he was responsible for sending her former fiance to his death on the battlefield.
Source: Gineipedia
name: Erich von Hartenburg
